intro: Bomarea huanuco, commonly known as the Huanuco bomarea, is a climbing perennial plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, funnel-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright blue or violet flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Bomarea huanuco is often found in moist, shaded habitats within montane forests.
